Name: A/B Testing
Definition: Testing "that allows testers to determine which of two systems or components performs better" (IEEE, 2022, p.1)

Name: Accessibility Testing
Definition: Testing "used to measure the degree to which a test item can be operated by users with the widest possible range of characteristics and abilities" (IEEE, 2022, p.1)

Name: Back-to-Back Testing
Definition: Testing "whereby an alternative version of the system is used to generate expected results for comparison from the same test inputs" (IEEE, 2022, p.2)
Notes: Similar to testing using a pseudo-oracle (Barr et al., 2015, p. 515)

Name: Boundary Value Analysis
Definition: Testing "based on exercising the boundaries of equivalence partitions" (IEEE, 2022, p.2)

Name: Branch Testing
Definition: Testing "based on exercising branches in the control flow of the test item" (IEEE, 2022, p. 2)

Name: Combinatorial Testing
Definition: Testing "based on exercising combinations of P-V pairs" (IEEE, 2022, p. 3)
Notes: P-V (Parameter-Value) Pair: "combination of a test item parameter with a value assigned to that parameter" (IEEE, 2022, p. 7). See also Engström and Petersen, 2015, pp. 1-2

Name: Compatibility Testing
Definition: "Testing that measures the degree to which a test item can function satisfactorily alongside other independent products in a shared environment (co-existence), and where necessary, exchanges information with other systems or components (interoperability)" (IEEE, 2022, p. 3)
Notes: Not atomic; implies the existence of "co-existence testing" and "interoperability testing"

Name: Decision Table Testing
Definition: Testing "based on exercising decision rules in a decision table" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4)
Notes: Decision Table: "tabular representation of decision rules between causes (inputs described as Boolean conditions) and effects (outputs described as Boolean expressions)" (IEEE, 2022, p.3). See also Peters and Pedrycz, 2000, pp. 448,450-453

Name: Decision Testing
Definition: Testing "based on exercising decision outcomes in the control flow of the test item" (IEEE, 2022, p.4)

Name: Dynamic Testing
Definition: "Testing in which a test item is evaluated by executing it" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4)

Name: Equivalence Partitioning
Definition: Testing "designed to exercise equivalence partitions by using one or more representative members of each partition" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4)

Name: Error Guessing
Definition: Testing based on "the tester's knowledge of past failures, or general knowledge of failure modes" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4)

Name: Exhaustive Testing
Definition: Testing "in which all combinations of input values and preconditions are tested" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4)
Notes: Impossible in most non-trivial situations (IEEE, 2022, p. 4; Peters and Pedrycz, 2000, pp. 439,461; van Vliet, 2000, p. 421)

Name: Experience-based Testing
Definition: Testing "using the experience of testers to generate test cases" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4)
Notes: "Can include concepts such as test attacks, tours, and error taxonomies" (IEEE, 2022, p. 4). See also Patton, 2006, pp. 88-89
